column1: a clover’s simple fame
a dayl help! help! another day
a great hope fell, you heard no noise
a house upon the height
a man may drop a remark
a pit—but heaven over it
a shade upon the mind there passes
a tongue to tell him i am true
above oblivion’s tide there is a pier
absence disembodies, so does death
absent place, an april day
after all birds have been investigated and laid aside
all that i do is in review
always mine! no more vacation
arrows enamored of his breast
art thou the thing i wanted
artists wrestled here
as old as woe—how old is that
as watchers hang upon the east
as willing lid o’er weary eye
because he loves her we will pry
bee, i’m expecting you
besides this may we know
better than music, for i who heard it
bind me, i still can sing
bloom is result. to meet a flower
brother of ingots—ah, peru
but silence is infinity
circumference, thou bride of awe
civilization spurns the leopard
convicted could we be
could live —did live. could die —did die
crumbling is not an instant’s act
death leaves us homesick who behind
death’s waylaying not the sharpest
death-warrants are supposed to be
delight’s despair at setting
did life’s penurious length
did we disobey him
dying at my music
dying, dying in the night
dying, to be afraid of thee
each scar i’ll keep for him
elizabeth told essex
“escape” is such a thankful word
escaping backward, to perceive
extol thee—could i—then i will
fairer through fading, as the day
faith slips and laughs and rallies
“faithful to the end,” amended
fame’s boys and girls who never die
floss won’t save you from an abyss
flowers—well, if anybody
four trees upon a solitary acre
glass was the street, in tinsel peril
“go tell it”—what a message
“good night,” because we must
good to hide and hear ’em hunt
had we our senses—though perhaps
he found my being, set it up
he scanned it—staggered, dropped the loop
he strained my faith—did he find it supple
he was my host, he was my guest
he was weak and i was strong, then
here, where the daisies fit my head
“houses,” so the wise men tell me
how far is it to heaven
how fleet, how indiscreet an one
how mighty the wind must feel morns
how news must feel when traveling
how sick to wait
how soft a caterpillar steps —
i am alive, i guess
i cannot buy it, ’tis not sold
i could bring you jewels
i cried at pity, not at pain
i’d rather recollect a setting
i had the glory—that will do
i have never seen volcanoes
i know suspense, it steps so terse
i met a king this afternoon
“i want/* it pleaded all its life
i was a phebe, nothing more
if blame be my side forfeit me
if i’m lost now, that i was found
if this is “fading*'
if wrecked upon the shoal of thought
i’ll clutch and clutch
i’ll tell thee all—how blank it grew
in crashing timbers buried
in this short life
it bloomed and dropped a single noon
it came at last, but prompter death
it don't sound so terrible, quite, as it did
it rises, passes, on our south
it sifts from leaden sieves, ii
its little ether hood
i’ve dropped my brain, my soul is numb
i’ve none to tell me to but thee
jesus, thy crucifix
kill your balm, and its odors bless you
knock with tremor, these are caesars
knows how to forget i
knows how to forget ii
lain in nature, so suffice us
least bee that brew a honey’s weight
least rivers
left in immortal youth on that low plain
let me not thirst with this hock at my lip
lethe in my flower
lift it, with the feathers
like time’s appointed wrinkle
long years apart can make no breach
luck is not chance, ’tis toil
mama never forgets her birds
me, change! me, alter! then i will
my heart upon a little plate
my season’s furthest flower
no matter now, sweet
not so the infinite relations
of paradise’ existence
of the heart that goes in
oh, future  thou secreted peace
oh, give it motion! deck it sweet
oh, sumptuous moment, slower go
one crown not any seek
one year ago jots what
or fame erect her siteless citadel
ourselves were wed one summer, dear
over the fence strawberries grow go
pausing against our palsied faces
praise it—’tis dead, it cannot glow
rearrange a wife’s affection
“red sea,” indeedl talk not to me
rests at night the sun from shining
robbed by death, but that was easy
said death to passion, “give of thine
sang from the heart. sire
“secrets” is a daily word
september’s baccalaureate
“shall i take thee?” the poet said
she sights a bird, she chuckles
sift her from brow to bare foot
snow, beneath whose chilly softness
so much summer me for showing
some wretched creature, savior, take
someone prepared this mighty show
somewhere upon the general earth
soul, take thy risks
still own thee—still thou art
struck was i, nor yet by lightning
such is the strength of happiness
sunset that screens, reveals
sweet mountains, ye tell me no lie
sweet safe houses—glad gay houses
sweet, you forgot, but i remembered
that’s the battle of burgoyne
the bird did prance, the bee did play
the birds begun at four o’clock
the blackberry wears a thorn in his side
the bobolink is gone
the butterfly’s numidian gown
the day she goes or day she stays
the earth has many keys
the first we knew of him was death xxv,
the hallowing of pain ^
the manner of its death
the most pathetic thing  do
the name of it is autumn
the parasol is the umbrella’s daughter
the pedigree of honey ii
the poets light but lamps xxvi,
the sun is one, and on the tare
the sun kept stooping, stooping low
the thrill came slowly like a boon
the truth is stirless. other force
the vastest earthly day xxiv,
the well upon the brook
there is a strength in knowing that it can be borne
this chasm, sweet, upon my life _
this dust and its feature
those, dying then, knew where they went
’tis customary as we part
.'tis one by one the father counts
*tis true they shut me in the cold
to earn it by disdaining it xxv,
to him who keeps an orchis* heart
to lose, if one can find again
too scanty *twas to die for you
touch lightly nature’s sweet guitar
trudging to eden, looking backward
*twas crisis. all the length had passed
*twas fighting for his life he was
’twas here my summer paused
*twas like a maelstrom, with a notch
*twas love, not me
’twas my one glory
two butterflies went out at noon, ii
two travelers perishing in snow
’twould ease a butterfly
uncertain lease develops luster
under the light, yet under
unto the whole how add
up life’s hill with my little bundle
upon a lilac sea
upon concluded lives
“was not” was all the statement
we don't cry, tim and i
we like a hairbreadth ’scape
we met as sparks—diverging flints
w t e miss her, not because we see
were it but me that gained the height
what did they do since i saw them
what is paradise? who live there
what shall i do, it whimpers so
when bells stop ringing church begins
when i sec not, i better see
when one has given up one’s life
when what they sung for is undone
which is the best, the moon or the crescent
which misses most, the hand that tends
while it is alive, until death touches it
who is the east? the yellow man
who occupies this house
why should we hurry? why, indeed
winter is good, his hoar delights
within thy grave! oh, no
without a smile, without a throe
you love me? you are sure
you said that i was “great one day"
you’ll know her by her foot

you're right, “the way is narrow"
